name: Environaut\Checks\ExecutableCheck
short_desc: Check to get absolute paths to executable files that may be used within an application.
long_desc:
As even paths to
 simple tools like "ls", "find" or "grep" may not be
 accessible in e.g. crontabs due to non-configured
 default PATH environment variables they can be searched
 and configured prior running the application (and thus
 always use the validated absolute executable paths).

 Supported parameters are:
 - "command": name of executable/command to check
 - "setting": name of setting to use for absolute path storage (for export)
 - "setting_group": name of settings group to use (for export; defaults to "config")
 - "question": question to ask the user (defaults to "Path to the executable [command]")
 - "default": default command or executable path to try (defaults to "/usr/bin/[command]")
 - "validator": validator callable to use (defaults to one, that uses "which" to find the path of the command)
 - "max_attempts": maximum number of attempts a user is allowed to have for correct input of a path

getDefaultGroupName.name: getDefaultGroupName
getDefaultGroupName.short_desc: Returns the default group name this check uses when none is specified.
getDefaultGroupName.hint_desc: default group name of the check

getDefaultSettingGroupName.name: getDefaultSettingGroupName
getDefaultSettingGroupName.short_desc: Returns the default group name this check uses for settings when none is specified.
getDefaultSettingGroupName.hint_desc: default group name of settings of this check

run.name: run
run.short_desc: Ask user for an absolute path to the given executable or try to determine it by itself using the default value (on confirmation).
exceptions: on setup errors like "choices" can't be interpreted or parameters being wrong
if there is no data to read in the input stream
when the maximum number of attempts has been reached and no valid response has been given

validExecutable.name: validExecutable
validExecutable.short_desc: Checks whether the given input value leads to an executable that matches the configured version_mask parameter.
exceptions: in case of non-existing executable at the given path or version mismatch

DEFAULT_SETTING_GROUP_NAME.name: DEFAULT_SETTING_GROUP_NAME
DEFAULT_SETTING_GROUP_NAME.short_desc: Default group of settings that this check stores in the result.

DEFAULT_CUSTOM_GROUP_NAME.name: DEFAULT_CUSTOM_GROUP_NAME
DEFAULT_CUSTOM_GROUP_NAME.short_desc: Default group name used in messages of the report.
DEFAULT_CUSTOM_GROUP_NAME.long_desc: By default also used as default setting group name if not customized.
